column2: Provide comprehensive medical care to critically ill patients admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) and high-dependency units (HDU), including assessment, diagnosis, treatment, and monitoring of acute and complex medical conditions     Perform invasive procedures and interventions, such as endotracheal intubation, central venous catheterization, arterial line placement, and chest tube insertion, as needed to stabilize and support critically ill patients     Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including intensivists, nurses, respiratory therapists, and allied health professionals, to develop and implement patient care plans tailored to individual patient needs and treatment goals     Conduct daily rounds, bedside assessments, and clinical evaluations of patients in the ICU/HDU to assess response to treatment, identify changes in clinical status, and adjust management strategies accordingly     Interpret diagnostic tests and imaging studies, such as laboratory tests, electrocardiograms (ECG), chest X-rays, and computed tomography (CT) scans, to aid in diagnosis and guide treatment decisions

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Senior Registrar Critical Care to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Senior Registrar in Critical Care, you will be a key member of the intensive care team, providing specialized care for critically ill patients      This role involves overseeing the management of complex medical cases, contributing to the education and training of junior staff, and actively participating in quality improvement initiatives within the critical care unit        Key Responsibilities:        Patient Care:Provide expert medical care for critically ill patients in the intensive care unit (ICU)      Conduct thorough patient assessments, formulate diagnoses, and develop and implement treatment plans      Monitor and manage complex medical cases, including respiratory failure, sepsis, and other critical conditions      Multidisciplinary Collaboration:Collaborate with intensivists, nurses, respiratory therapists, and other healthcare professionals to ensure coordinated and comprehensive patient care      Participate in daily multidisciplinary rounds, presenting patient cases and contributing to care discussions      Work closely with the healthcare team to address patient needs and optimize outcomes      Supervision and Training:Supervise and mentor junior medical staff, including residents and interns, providing guidance on patient management and critical care procedures      Contribute to the development and delivery of educational programs for medical students, residents, and other healthcare professionals      Facilitate bedside teaching and case discussions      Quality Improvement:Participate in quality improvement initiatives within the critical care unit      Identify areas for improvement in patient care processes and actively contribute to the development of best practices      Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of critical care services      Emergency Response:Respond to medical emergencies within the hospital, providing expertise in resuscitation and stabilization      Collaborate with code response teams and participate in emergency preparedness activities      Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate and detailed medical records, ensuring compliance with documentation standards      Prepare reports on patient outcomes, complications, and critical care unit performance

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Resident Clinical Services to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Resident Clinical Services typically refers to a position within a healthcare organization where a resident or trainee works in a clinical setting, such as a hospital or medical facility, under the supervision of attending physicians and senior medical staff       As a Resident Clinical Services, your responsibilities may include:       Patient Care: Providing direct patient care, including conducting medical examinations, diagnosing illnesses, prescribing medications, and developing treatment plans     This involves interacting with patients, gathering medical histories, and performing physical examinations     Learning and Training: Engaging in a structured educational program to enhance medical knowledge and clinical skills     This includes attending lectures, participating in case discussions, and receiving supervision and feedback from senior medical staff     Documentation: Maintaining accurate and complete medical records, documenting patient encounters, diagnoses, treatments, and other relevant information     This includes adhering to legal and ethical standards for medical record keeping     Continuity of Care: Assisting in the coordination of patient care across different healthcare settings, such as outpatient clinics, emergency departments, and operating rooms     This involves participating in handover processes and ensuring smooth transitions of care     Professional Development: Engaging in self-directed learning and professional development activities to enhance medical knowledge and skills     This may include attending conferences, participating in research projects, and staying updated with advancements in medical practice

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Consultant Cardiology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A Cardiology Consultant, also known as a Cardiologist, is a medical professional specializing in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases and disorders related to the cardiovascular system     They provide expert medical care to patients with heart and blood vessel conditions     Here are the key responsibilities and qualifications typically associated with the role of a Cardiology Consultant:Patient Care and Diagnosis: Conduct thorough patient evaluations, including medical history reviews, physical examinations, and diagnostic tests such as electrocardiograms (ECGs), echocardiograms, stress tests, and cardiac catheterization     Formulate accurate diagnoses based on clinical findings and test results     Treatment and Intervention: Develop personalized treatment plans for patients with cardiovascular conditions, which may include prescribing medications, recommending lifestyle modifications, or performing invasive procedures such as angioplasty, stenting, or cardiac surgery     Monitor patient progress and make necessary adjustments to treatment plans     Consultation and Collaboration: Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, including primary care physicians, surgeons, and specialists, to provide comprehensive patient care     Offer consultation services to colleagues and healthcare teams seeking cardiology expertise     Emergency Intervention: Respond to emergencies involving cardiac issues, such as heart attacks or arrhythmias     Provide immediate medical intervention, resuscitation, and stabilization as necessary     Research and Education: Stay updated with the latest developments in cardiology research, treatments, and technologies     Contribute to clinical research studies and publications     Participate in continuing medical education (CME) activities to enhance professional knowledge and skills     Mentor and educate medical students, residents, and fellows     Patient Counseling and Education: Educate patients and their families about their cardiovascular conditions, treatment options, and preventive measures     Offer guidance on lifestyle modifications, such as diet, exercise, and stress management, to improve cardiovascular health     Quality Assurance and Documentation: Ensure accurate and timely documentation of patient encounters, diagnoses, treatments, and outcomes     Adhere to quality assurance protocols, regulatory guidelines, and ethical standards in patient care

column2: A Technician in Central Sterile Supply Department (CSSD) is a healthcare professional responsible for the cleaning, sterilization, and distribution of medical supplies, instruments, and equipment used in healthcare facilities     They play a crucial role in maintaining the cleanliness, safety, and effectiveness of medical supplies to prevent infections and ensure optimal patient care     Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role of a Technician in CSSD:Cleaning and decontamination: The CSSD Technician cleans and decontaminates reusable medical supplies, instruments, and equipment using appropriate cleaning agents, disinfectants, and cleaning equipment     They follow standard operating procedures and infection control protocols to ensure effective cleaning and removal of contaminants     Sterilization processes: The Technician operates sterilization equipment, such as autoclaves, to sterilize medical instruments and supplies     They ensure that sterilization cycles are set correctly, monitor the sterilization process, and verify the effectiveness of sterilization through biological and chemical indicators     Inventory management: The CSSD Technician maintains an inventory of medical supplies and equipment, ensuring an adequate supply for patient care     They monitor stock levels, perform regular inventory checks, and coordinate with procurement or supply chain departments to replenish stock as needed     Quality control and assurance: The Technician conducts quality control checks and tests to ensure that sterilization and cleaning processes meet regulatory standards and guidelines     They perform routine inspections, document results, and report any deviations or non-compliance to the appropriate authorities     Equipment maintenance: They perform routine maintenance, cleaning, and calibration of CSSD equipment to ensure optimal performance     The Technician may troubleshoot equipment malfunctions, perform minor repairs, and coordinate with biomedical engineering or equipment vendors for major repairs or servicing     Record-keeping and documentation: The CSSD Technician maintains accurate and up-to-date records of cleaning, sterilization, and distribution activities     They document sterilization cycles, load contents, equipment maintenance logs, and other relevant information as required by regulatory agencies
column11: Procurement, Supply chain, Patient care, Standard operating procedures, Healthcare, Manager Quality Control, Equipment maintenance, biomedical, Inventory

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Resident - Gastroenterology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As a Resident in Gastroenterology, you are a medical professional undergoing specialized training in the field of gastroenterology     Gastroenterology focuses on the diagnosis, treatment, and management of disorders and diseases related to the digestive system       Here are some key responsibilities and areas of expertise for a Resident in Gastroenterology:       Patient Evaluation and Diagnosis: You perform comprehensive evaluations of patients with gastrointestinal symptoms or disorders     This involves taking detailed medical histories, conducting physical examinations, ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests (such as endoscopy, colonoscopy, imaging studies), and making accurate diagnoses     Gastrointestinal Procedures: You gain proficiency in performing or assisting with various gastrointestinal procedures     This includes diagnostic and therapeutic endoscopies (such as upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, colonoscopy, and endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography - ERCP), as well as other interventions like esophageal dilation, polypectomy, and stent placement     Treatment Planning and Management: Based on your assessment and diagnosis, you develop and implement treatment plans for patients with gastrointestinal conditions     This may involve prescribing medications, recommending lifestyle modifications, providing dietary advice, and coordinating care with other specialists, such as surgeons or oncologists, when necessary     Inpatient and Outpatient Care: As a resident, you provide care to patients in both inpatient and outpatient settings     In the inpatient setting, you manage the care of hospitalized patients with acute gastrointestinal conditions, perform consultations, and oversee their treatment plans     In the outpatient setting, you see patients in clinic visits for follow-ups, routine screenings, and management of chronic gastrointestinal conditions     Endoscopy and Procedural Skills: During your residency, you develop proficiency in endoscopic procedures and techniques     This includes gaining expertise in maneuvering endoscopes, visualizing and interpreting endoscopic findings, and performing biopsies or therapeutic interventions as necessary
column11: Gastroenterology

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Senior Resident Anaesthesiology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Senior Resident in Anaesthesiology, your role is to provide specialized medical care and expertise in the field of anaesthesiology      You will work in a clinical or hospital setting, collaborating with surgeons, physicians, and other healthcare professionals to ensure the safe administration of anaesthesia during surgical procedures and the effective management of perioperative care        Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with this role:        Preoperative Assessment: Conduct thorough preoperative assessments of patients, evaluating their medical history, physical condition, and any pre-existing conditions or medications that may impact anaesthesia      Determine the appropriate anaesthetic plan for each patient      Anaesthesia Administration: Administer various types of anaesthesia, including general anaesthesia, regional anaesthesia, and monitored anaesthesia care, depending on the specific surgical procedure and patient needs      Monitor vital signs, adjust anaesthetic levels as necessary, and ensure patient comfort and safety throughout the procedure      Patient Monitoring: Continuously monitor and assess patient vital signs, including heart rate, blood pressure, oxygen saturation, and end-tidal carbon dioxide levels      Utilize advanced monitoring techniques, such as arterial lines, central venous catheters, and cardiac output monitors, to ensure optimal patient stability during surgery      Airway Management: Perform airway management techniques, including endotracheal intubation, mask ventilation, and the placement of advanced airway devices      Respond to airway emergencies and manage difficult airway situations effectively      Intraoperative Support: Collaborate closely with surgeons and surgical teams to provide intraoperative support, including fluid management, blood transfusion management, and rapid response to changes in patient status      Administer additional medications or interventions as required
